fields.description:
A staging dialog is close to pointless when you need to stage 10 files or so.

Each time a dialog is popping, that's ridiculous.
Additionally the process in the background is not even finished, the staged files are stuck for a noticeable time before anything updates - so the statement that the staging was completed but the UI being stuck is also an issue.

Proposal: 
1- Fix the update on the staged/unstaged files
2- Add a setting to disable this Staging Dialog Window coming up or AT LEAST allow a multi selection before validation!
fields.summary: Staging Dialog is crippled - allow to keep it hidden

fields.description: In "Log in to your Atlassion account" dialog. SourceTree crashes after log in successfully.
fields.summary: Unhandled exception at 0x00007FF862C5AAAC (jscript9.dll) in SourceTree.exe: 0xC0000005: Access violation reading location 0x0000000000000008.

fields.description: The diffs in the diff viewer no longer fill the whole width of the viewer. Each diff now appears as a separate rectangle centered horizontally in the diff viewer, where the width is determined by the longest line of text in the diff. See attached screenshot for an example.
fields.summary: Diffs don't fill the diff window

fields.description:
You made the same horrible mistake as Microsoft when releasing the initial VS2013.

-No color icons and UI reduced to low fonts.
This is absolutely counter-productive and UI is a lot less readable than previously.

To learn from the other's mistakes, after a huge number of complaints the UI from VS was corrected to use proper icons with colors and distinctions to keep the interface readable and useful. Please do the same, currently the new version is a major regression.
fields.summary: UI update from 1.8.2.2 (win)
Size of comparison window

fields.description: SourceTree crashed after upgrading from 1.5.2 to 1.8.2
fields.summary: Error on startup

fields.description: Unfortunately my icons in SourceTree lost all their beautiful colors ... any ideas? Is that a graphic card issue? ;-) Please bring back the nice icons. Thx
fields.summary: Icons lost color

fields.description:
Latest version returns the following error when running  Python precommit script

/usr/bin/env: python: No such file or directory

changing the shebang does not seem to make any difference, SourceTree on Windows seems to always tries to start Python using the Unix path. Used to work with previous versions.
fields.summary: Python precommit hook fails with latest version

fields.description:
- treeview is missing in files view (we have a large repo with multiple libraries and most of the time I'm just interested in the library I'm working on)
- right click on a changed file from somebody else's commit, its no longer possible to do a diff using an external tool
- if staging two files quickly after each other the second one fails (staging is slow as well)
-- error "fatal: Unable to create <folder>/.git/index.lock': File exists."
- when multiple files are selected clicking the stage checkmark results in only one file being staged
- looking at changed files while building a large project (= a lot excluded files are changed) the diff view is loosing focus, changing to other/no file
-- expected behavior is that I can review my changes while doing a build
- large merges or complex operations are cumbersome because SourceTree crashes sometimes (sorry can't exactly describe what I was doing because at such moments I'm focused on my task and not keeping track of where I'm clicking)
- if the last line in the file is changed that is not visible in the difference view (no matter how many lines of context are set)

feel free to split this issue into multiple issues, I'm not conservative with regards to the look and feel but I am with regards to stability and functionality which seem to have decreased since 1.8.*
- please consider to have a 'downgrade' option in the future when doing such major changes
fields.summary: missing functionality since upgrade/unstable

fields.description:
Brings up the attached error every time I do a hg update or refresh the repository.
Seems to be a issue with hg log trying to access some temporary file which is not found.
fields.summary: Error when refreshing repository

fields.description: Used to be able to drag files from unstaged to staged but this does not work any more. Need to click on the checkbox to move the item or use the stage hunk
fields.summary: Drag and drop does not work between unstaged and staged files boxes

fields.description:
The chunks of a diff are centered rather than left aligned.

See attached image : !image-2016-02-25-10-01-08-085.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Diff chunks are centered rather than left aligned

fields.description: 1st and 3rd lines in the first image look different from the others. Text in the second image looks weird (cyrrilic part).
fields.summary: Something happened with diff font after update

fields.description:
System.ArgumentException: The number of elements in this collection must be less than or equal to 

'65535'.
Parameter name: glyphIndices
fields.summary: Fatal error when browsing diffs

fields.description:
(1) In diff views, before the recent UI overhaul, I could select a range of lines for staging/unstaging, by:
* clicking a line and shift-clicking another line
or
* holding shift and using the arrow keys
Neither is working now.

(2) Arrow keys no longer move the cursor. The 'up' arrow focuses menus above which is very unexpected.

(3) Possibly related: selection by mouse is working, but in a non-standard way: dragging back towards the origin point of the drag gesture is expected to contract the selection, but the mouse now "paints" selectedness instead of defining a linear range between the start and stop coordinates.
fields.summary: Shift (range) selection, arrow keys in diffs no longer work

fields.description:
When I select restart merge from the drop-down menu opened on a file in the staged or unstaged window, nothing happens. Merge doesn't get restarted.

In some cases (no steps to reproduce) the dialog box with the question whether I want to really restart the merge an another file from the unstaged window is listed as well (usually the first file in that window).
fields.summary: Cannot restart a merge

fields.description: Whenever during merge the external merge tool (BeyondCompare in my case) exits, SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: SourceTree repeatedly crashes after external merge tool exits.

fields.description:
1. Open a git repository that has a submodule
2. Right click on "Submodules" in repo navigator
3. Click on "Change source URL..."

Result:
SourceTree crashes

For the record, I expected right clicking on "Submodules" to give me a way to add one and see the current URLs.
fields.summary: Crash on "Change source URL..." on Submodules

fields.description:
After upgrading from Sourcetree 1.6.22 to 1.8.2.2 every commit hook with a shebang line like #!/usr/bin/env ruby does not work anymore.

Sourcetree aborts with a "file not found error". See image ruby.PNG.
On windows command line every hook works fine. See image ruby3.PNG

This is a dealbreaker for use because we cannot use any hook anymore on windows computers
fields.summary: Sourcetree fails on hooks with shebang ruby line

fields.description: On startup, the application hangs with CPU at 100%
fields.summary: SourceTree Hangs on Startup
If the file name has invalid character like -> and failed to created, source tree didn't complaint and tell the pull is done

fields.description:
new version of SourceTree (1.8.2.2) shows double character spacing for non-english characters/

See picture
fields.summary: Bad Unicode symbols rendering

fields.description: As summarized. Updating to the latest version with new UI, etc. Can no longer drag files between un-staged and staged lists.
fields.summary: Unable to to drag files from Unstaged to Staged lists

fields.description: Lock file error keeps on appearing when large amount of untracked files are displayed
fields.summary: Lock file error when repo has large amount of items untracked

fields.description: Diff view is missing background color
fields.summary: Missing background color

fields.description:
Picked out line in code block and pressed Ctrl+C, SourceTree falled.
http://i.imgur.com/Zr4lNzF.png

Also code line copyed to clioboard.
fields.summary: Fall SourceTree

fields.description: The horizontal scrollbar no longer appears, so I am unable to view code changes that are wider than the viewport. Even setting the focus and using the arrow keys does not work.
fields.summary: Horizontal Scrollbar for commit changes is missing with last update.
Double clicking on Branches UI label will cause Sourcetree to attempt to checkout a nonexistent branch named "Branches"

fields.description:
After normal startup, a few clicks will triggers sourcetree to puke rainbows all over the window (see attached).
Update: After upgrade to 1.8.2.3, the problem appears on first start only, so I lowered the priority (was blocker).
fields.summary: Rainbow Puke

fields.description: Previous versions of SourceTree has a Display as Treeview (alongside Flat list single column/multi column) - the Treeview option has been removed.  I found this display option handy since it allowed me to Stage an entire folder with a single click of the folder, now I have to stage each file individually which is quite time consuming for large folders (there does not seem to be anyway to select multiple files and stage them all at once)
fields.summary: Display as "Treeview" has disappeared

fields.description:
Right clicking on a staged file initially shows the correct menu options, including external diff.
However after a short period, the context changes and most options are greyed out. Only remaining options relate to 'merges', but the submenu is completely greyed out.

This relates to the issue I raised regarding the side panel functionality: SRCTREEWIN-4818
fields.summary: Context menu chnages to 'merge' incorrectly when selecting a staged file

fields.description: I had just downloaded and isntalled the latest version of Sourcetree. I was asked to enter my Atlassian account details, which I did, but was then told my password expired. I clicked the password reset button, got the email, entered a new password, then returned to Sourcetree and logged in with my new password. I saw the confirmation screen that I was successfully logged in, clicked the OK button and the application immediately crashed.
fields.summary: Crash after entering Atlassian account details
Source tree crashed after upgrade

fields.description: When opening a repository within SourceTree and clicking on any file Log / History row I receive multiple Error encountered dialogs. All the dialogs have the same error message. I can no longer see the files changed when clicking on any row.
fields.summary: Receiving error when clicking on file change rows within repository.
Diff preview too small

fields.description:
upgraded to 1.8.2 from ?, I can't commit, UI locks up, takes forever to stage files.

Where are your previous release installers?  I need to reinstalled the last stable release (before the icon style change).
fields.summary: Not ready for prime time...where do I get previous releases?

fields.description:
When I press the toggle (Branches and Tags) SourceTree will try to checkout.


Example:
 I tried to toggle the Branches and SourceTree tried to checkout "Branches"
 !image-2016-02-25-11-29-52-967.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Toggling checks out repo
Open After

fields.description: opening sourcetree, it starts flickering every second or so. very annoying and I had to close it. seems like it refreshes itself very often.
fields.summary: flickering sourcetree

fields.description: After this mornings update, a merge in kdiff will crash SourceTree when I close kdiff.  Restarting SourceTree everything looks fine.
fields.summary: Crashing after a merge

fields.description: When I mark the non-listed files it does not update automatic for the listed files to commit, I have to switch to the log screen / history then return to file status to be able to do the commit, it seems that the screen is not the refresh.
fields.summary: commits screen does not update automatic

fields.description: I personally hate the File Status view.  I have always liked the Log/History view to display the branch trees and also the changes on any files.  I don't know if these were split out or what but I don't like the File Status view.  I keep selecting the Log/History view but it constantly keeps switching back to the File Status view.  Please bring it back to the way it was before or provide the capability either select the default view or at least *KEEP* in in the selected view.
fields.summary: File Status - Log / History views

fields.description: With the 1.8.1 version (which I don't know if it has been fixed in the 1.8.2 yet) but I've noticed that after doing a merge conflict (using kdiff3) and saving the changes, returning to SourceTree it crashes (which is still noted as doing that in 1.8.2).  But the SourceTree displays the file in the Staged panel and a new file with a .orig suffix in the unstaged files panel.  I normally then remove the .orig file from unstaged panel.  But in doing that, now the file in the staged panel gets marked as "Deleted" with the "D" icon.  I've tried unstaging the file and then discarding the changes but that only ends up deleting the file (which has caused me to loose my accepted merge changes).  So right now the merge conflicts functionality is totally non functioning.
fields.summary: Wrong file being deleted after a merge fix

fields.description: tree view of files has been discontinued. the "flat list multiple columns" is not a good alternative.
fields.summary: "tree view" is no longer available

fields.description: I selected several lines in the diff view and hit "Discard Lines" but the entire hunk got discarded.  This used to work until I recently updated.
fields.summary: Discard selected lines did a discard hunk!
new sourcetree version would not open my project
install mercurial error

fields.description: I installed the latest version of Atlassian SourceTree for Windows and was following the setup process using the Atlassian account. After skipping the setup for Bitbucket/Bitbucket Server/Github, I was prompted for an SSH key. I selected a Putty encrypted RSA key, and was prompted for the password to decrypt the key by Pageant. After the prompt had appeared and I had typed about 3 characters, the crash screen registered.
fields.summary: Adding a Putty encrypted RSA key during setup resulted in a crash (right after Pageant prompted for the password)

fields.description: I just go the latest version, and a lot of UI changed.  I don't like the centering of the diffs in the diff pane at the right.  It throws off my scan of the entire diff chain when I scroll through that pane.  Can't it just be all left-aligned again? thanks.
fields.summary: Centering of diffs ... I don't like it

fields.summary: SourceTree hangs for a very long time when focusing some commit lines

fields.description:
I updated to v1.8.2, ran it, accepted the license and logged in (via Google). Everything worked fine.

Later I opened sourcetree again, saw the license/login again and then it crashed.

See attachment.
fields.summary: Crash when starting SourceTree

fields.description: I've attached an image of the behavior, but it looks like the line-by-line code comparison between commits is sizing to fit the text, when it should be sizing to fit the panel. This bug appears to have been introduced in 1.8.2, since this behavior was not present on my computer with the previous version.
fields.summary: Code difference panel sizing issue

fields.description: Starting with the most recent versions (where the icons were flattened and color removed), the spacebar no longer checks/unchecks files in the staging area, which requires actually checking the boxes by individual files. When you just have a few changes to commit (or want to have all of them committed), this is no big deal, but selecting groups of files at a time with the keyboard no longer works.
fields.summary: Spacebar no longer activates checkboxes in unstaged files

fields.description: I updated I clicked run it died
fields.summary: Updted and it crashed
Copying a line from a stashed changeset crashes the client.

fields.description:
When I click Merge "Production" into current branch the confirm message is:

"Are you sure you want to merge 'File Status' into your current branch?" (see attachment)

----------------------------------------------------
Merge file status (see attachment):

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false merge "File Status"
merge: File Status - not something we can merge

Completed with errors, see above.
-----------------------------------------------------

Note: Same issues is happening when I try to merge any two branches using the right click "merge xxx into current branch", or try to delete a branch (attachment).

See like the selection on the tree is not working properly and every time it jumps to the top of the tree, that is "File Status".
fields.summary: Can't Merge Production Branch with current Branch

fields.description: To me, the new 1.8. UI looks more like downgrade (to 10yo gnome like interface) rather than upgrade. May be it was attempt to go for the popular these days "flat design" , but to not very successful for now....
fields.summary: 1.8 UI looks like downgrade

fields.description: As a user, I would like the option to remove text and make icons smaller so that I can have more real estate for the things I care about.
fields.summary: Small Icons / No Text Bar
cant scroll horizantly
Crashed after update

fields.description:
I just updated to the latest version and tree view is gone!
Nevertheless the option "Enable Tree View as file listing option" is checked.
fields.summary: Tree view is gone

fields.description: Tried to open a terminal and got a crash instead.  This was just after install.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed while starting a terminal

fields.description:
When resolving merge conflicts:
# Right click item with merge conflicts in working directory
# Resolve Conflicts > Launch External Merge tool
# Correct conflicts in tool (TortiseMerge)
# Close Merge Tool, Sourcetree crashes
fields.summary: Crashes after closing external merge tool.

fields.description:
When I click the checkbox next to "Unstaged files", to stage all changes, the windows above it will display a "circling progress bar", but will never return and SourceTree hangs.

After restarting SourceTree, the files do appear to be staged and normal work can continue.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs when using "checkbox" to stage all changes, if "Always display full console output" is checked

fields.description:
Version 1.8.2.2
Horizontal scrolling is not available in the Diff area on File Status Tab. It used to be on the very bottom, now it is gone (see screenshot).
Workaround: using external diff.

OS: Windows 8.1
fields.summary: No horizontal scrolling in Diff on File Status Tab

fields.description: I know people are generally resistant to change, but this new UI design sucks. All the folders and icons are light in color and hard to see. What's up with the blinking commit button, that turns white and you can't read the text? It is very BLAH and unattractive. BORING AND LAME
fields.summary: New UI

fields.description: In Tools > Options I have checked the box labeled "Enable Tree View as a file listing option", but in the Log / History window, and the File Status window I only have the options  for Flat list. The Tree View in these windows saved me a lot of me time. Please bring it back.
fields.summary: Tree View No Longer an Option
Crash on startup after updating

fields.description: When viewing the difference between two past commits (CTRL + Click to select) and right clicking on a file there is no longer the option "External Diff".  You can still use the CTRL + D option to open the external diff.
fields.summary: External diff not available when viewing past commits

fields.description:
Hi

I'm already a ST user. We host our own stash server on AWS rather than use Atlassian's SAS offering.
fields.summary: Crash after registration

fields.description: Crashes on Startup. Loads tree to the left ith woriking copy but crashes soon after. I only have git repos, all local, no mercurial or github.
fields.summary: Crash on Startup

fields.description:
Version 1.8.2.2
1. Commit
2. Click checkbox next to "Pending"
Expected: all changed files selected
Actual: no files selected - in order to commit, you have to manually click each file individually
fields.summary: Select all checkbox for Pending changes no longer works in latest update
On opening Source tree it crashes everytime

fields.description:
Strange context menu on submodules group:
Item "Open submodules" not clear what happens, think something like "Update submodules" maybe?

"Change submodule URL..." link in this context menu crashes soucetree
fields.summary: Crash when rightclicking on "submodules" group, change source URL

fields.description:
The new UI in SourceTree 1.8.x is a MAJOR dealbreaker to me and countless other users. Yet some people (presumably aliens whose vision works differently from that of humans) seem to like it, and for some reason the dev team seems committed to keeping it.

So why not let everyone have their way and support skins/themes? This would be a major general improvement to the app, besides the obvious advantage of ending this "war of religion" between old an new UI. Those who like the old look can keep it, the aliens can keep the new one, and creative contributors can design new and even better ones. Everyone wins.
fields.summary: Make SourceTree skinnable so everyone can have the UI they like best

fields.description:
Missing option to manage remotes when right clicking on the remotes part of the tree. It used to be possible to add a remote this way or manage existing remotes. 

Now you have to go to repository -> add remote... (and that should be named manage remotes as you can add and remove from that menu item)
fields.summary: Context menu on remotes no longer has option to manage the remotes

fields.description:
unable to open several repos in SourceTree
crash after double click

where can I download a stable previous version?
fields.summary: unable to open repo after update to latest version - client crash

fields.description:
I have a file that has both staged and unstaged changes. When in the Log/History tab I will only be able to see the changes from the first area I click on.

I open the application and click my file in the Staged area, I will see my changes. I click on the same file in the Unstaged area and see nothing in the diff. If I switch tabs and go back to Log/History and click on Unstaged, I see the unstaged changes. Click on Staged and see nothing.

Going to the File Status tab shows me all my information.
fields.summary: In Log/History view diff view is empty on some files in either Staged or Unstaged file view

fields.description:
- triggered the update from possibly 1.6? Not too certain, unfortunately.
- set up credentials with google log in
- finished update
- experienced crash on first launch after updating
- second launch seems normal
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed on first launch after update
SourceTree has crashed after double clicking on unstaged file and then canceling a request of opnening the file

fields.description:
Accidentally added a repository twice to the bookmarks panel on the left. When removing the one I added to the bottom of the list (selecting it and pressing the delete key), not the last item was removed but the first item in the top of the list.

This caused me to have to manually reorder the item back to the original spot in the list.
fields.summary: Remove bookmark when available multiple times removed first one even if last is selected

fields.description:
Lithuanian characters are not displayed in preview panel.
General settings -> Default text encoding is set to utf-8.

Tested characters:
ąčėęįšūųž
ĄČĖĘĮŠŪŲŽ
fields.summary: Lithuanian characters are not displayed in preview panel

fields.description:
I'm using system git (version 2.7.1)
-I can not create release or feature on existing repository using "Git Flow" button from toolbar
-I can not init Git Flow on new repository using "Git Flow" button from toolbar

When I switch to Empedded git (version 1.9.5) - works fine.
Updated Embedded git to version 2.6.1, also works fine.
fields.summary: GitFlow is not working with system git 2.7.1

fields.description:
We have a pre-commit hook installed, which executes python script. When committing from SourceTree I'm getting message "python: unknown command". 
Path to python executable added to %PATH% variable
Running "git commit ..." from console - works just fine
fields.summary: PATH environment variable seems to be not working when committing from SourceTree

fields.description: With refresh when files changed is turned on in the settings, Visual Studio 2015 becomes very slow to function when writing code or waiting for intellisense. The rest of the IDE works fine.
fields.summary: IntelliSense/Visual Studio becomes very slow when refresh files on change is ticketd

fields.description:
# If a line contains Cyrillic character, the font face in the internal diff viewer "jumps" randomly (see attachments 1.png and 2.png)
# I suppose the aforementioned behavior somehow is related to system font Consolas. However it's impossible to change font for internal diff viewer. See attachment 3.png - the font face is set to Arial, but internal diff still has Consolas. Certainly the SourceTree was restarted after font face setting change.
fields.summary: Internal diff view incorrect cyrillic font display

fields.description: 1 picture = 1000 words --> see attach
fields.summary: Commit differences summary screen shows invalid formatting

fields.description:
In new SourceTree Russian symbols on changes window breaks font:

 !Fonts.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Russian symbols breaks font

fields.description:
With new SourceTree we have some strange horizontal align in changes windows: 

!Spaces.png|thumbnail! 

In older versions its appears more pretty and readable.
fields.summary: Horizontal align in changes window

fields.description:
After update to new version (1.8.2.2) the icon of *SourceTree* is automaticaly pinned to the task bar.
What is wrong with you people?
Please make a option somewhere in install / update dialog so users easily decide to pin or not to pin *SourceTree* icon on taskbar.
fields.summary: Pin icon to the taskbar after update

fields.description: When staging files, it is extremely slow and has the spinner for a significant amount of time. In order to fix I have to restart the application and then it's staged.
fields.summary: Very slow at staging files

fields.description: Crash when installing
fields.summary: Failure when installing

fields.description: The icon for the installer is still the old one
fields.summary: Wrong Icon

fields.description:
1. I created a new repo containing containing some 100 files.
2. initial commit. By default checkbox "push immediately" is checked. There is no remote repo!
3. click "commit"
4. crash

after restart I see the new changeset. commit worked so far.
Maybe the crash is caused by missing remote repo.
fields.summary: Crash on initial commit

fields.description:
There are no horizontal scroll bars on the diff view on the right side so I am unable to see the entirety of the changed lines.

Possibly related to SRCTREEWIN-4684
fields.summary: Not horizontal scroll bars on diff view

fields.description:
In the Commit panel, select a .suo file that has change (Visual studio user config file. a binary file.)
The diff panel shows two buttons - Open 'Before'" and "Open 'After'".

** Assume that the .suo file extension  is not associated with any program in Windows.

If you click the 'After' button, a Windows pop-up message asks you to chose a program to open the file.
If you click the 'Before' button, SourceTree crashes...

This does not happen after you associate a program to the file extension,
fields.summary: App crash when using "Open 'Before'" button on .suo file

fields.description:
I configured .git to use p4merge or semanticmerge for merging conflicts. 

When I say to source tree to use the external tool, when I finished to merge my differences and I close the tool saving the file, source tree at that point crashes.

If, before saving, I press abort in source tree and then I save the file, it works as expected.
fields.summary: Crash using external tool p4merge or semanticmerge for merging conflicts

fields.description: The 'diff' panel initially correctly shows the expected diff. However, when moving the mouse, the screen updated and the diff panel is cleared and the diff disappears.
fields.summary: DIFF pannel doesn't work correctly

fields.description:
When I perform a merge between 2 branches, and get a conflict on a file, I try to resolve the conflict with the option "launch external merge tool" which starts Tortoise Merge.

In this program I can resolve the conflict and save the progress. When I exit the merge program, SourceTree crashes. After restarting SourceTree the file is marked as merged successfull.

The crash report gives this exception:
System.NullReferenceException was unhandled
Message: An unhandled exception of type 'System.NullReferenceException' occurred in SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf.dll
Additional information: De objectverwijzing is niet op een exemplaar van een object ingesteld.
fields.summary: Crash after resolving a conflict
